Job Description:
CPQ Systems Analyst

Empire Building Materials is seeking a CPQ Systems Analyst for our door manufacturing facility. This position will play a key role in assisting with a CPQ (configure, price, quote) software implementation and subsequent CPQ system maintenance.

Established in 1954, Empire Building Materials is a wholesale distributor of building products that sells to retail lumber yards and home centers throughout Montana, Wyoming, Idaho, North Dakota, South Dakota, and Washington. Empire Building Materials maintains its corporate headquarters in Bozeman Montana, and has distribution facilities in both Bozeman and Missoula Montana. In addition to our wholesale distribution, we operate two door shop facilities with locations in Bozeman and Missoula Montana.

As the CPQ Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting with the catalog build, system implementation, and product maintenance. This role will be a key player in the digital transformation of our business.

Catalog Build: Work with a team of employees to build an extensive catalog of our door products, including various configurations, specifications, and pricing options.

Product Implementation: Collaborate with the CPQ project team to ensure the successful implementation of the CPQ system. Serve as a product knowledge expert for our internal staff and our external customers.

Product Maintenance: Responsible for routine catalog build and releases throughout the year, including all applicable testing prior to releases. Manage and schedule version updates. Identify and implement changes to the CPQ to improve user experience, streamline processes, and ensure data accuracy. Maintain the integrity of product data, ensuring consistency and accuracy in the system. Responsible for image maintenance and updates.

Training and Support: Provide training and support to internal staff and external customers to ensure they can effectively utilize the CPQ system. Act as a first point of contact for our IT Services provider.

Additional Duties: This position has the potential to support our door manufacturing facilities in a number of other ways including programming and updating the Kval door library, utilizing Bistrack for scheduling and dispatch, and maintaining products on our website.

Competency:

Thorough understanding of information technology procedures and practices.
Flexible to changing needs.
Organized with attention to detail.
Works well with a team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent analytical, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Proficient with, or able to quickly become proficient with Bistrack, Paradigm Omni, and Kval software.
Proficient with Microsoft Office 365.
Experience with building and maintaining a manufacturing CPQ.
SQL and/or C++ programming language experience.

Education and Experience:

· A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Programming, or equivalent experience and training.

· 2 years’ experience as a systems/data analyst OR

· 2 year’s experience in door manufacturing or sales (preferred)

· Alternate combinations of education and experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $72,751.45 - $87,614.64 per year

THE OUTSIDE IS IN US ALL.

Applications missing the requested documents will be considered incomplete and may not progress further in the process. Documents not requested will not be considered in the recruitment process. The State Application is not a substitute for a Resume. This position closes at 11:59 PM Mountain Time on December 17, 2023. You must apply through the State of Montana Career site.



Identity of applicants who become finalists may be released to the public if the Department deems it necessary. Employees who exceed 1,040 hours in a calendar year are also provided health, dental and life insurance. Other benefits include retirement, paid vacation, sick and holidays. This position may be covered by a VEBA (Voluntary Employee Beneficiary Association).

A successful applicant will be subject to a background investigation.


Women and minorities are under-represented in this job category and are encouraged to apply.




Special Information:

Do you have experience managing natural resources spatial data and creating compelling GIS products? Are you interested in fisheries, wildlife, and natural resources information? Would you enjoy working with professionals dedicated to the stewardship of natural resources in Montana? If so, the Geographic Data Services Bureau at Montana Fish, Wildlife & Parks is recruiting for a GIS and Natural Resources Analyst. This position is a unique opportunity for a GIS professional interested in using their skills in a fish and wildlife agency.




The successful applicant will have experience with, and be interested in fish, wildlife and recreational resources in Montana and share a commitment to FWP's Vision and Mission. The ideal candidate will be analytical, detail oriented, creative, possess a strong work ethic, have a positive attitude and excellent people skills. This position requires excellent time management skills, collaborating successfully in a team environment, working independently on multiple priorities, and interacting with diverse groups of people. You must be an effective, knowledgeable, and engaging communicator. To be successful, you must clearly communicate concepts related to fisheries and wildlife science as well as GIS, data, and database concepts to individuals with both technical and non-technical backgrounds. You must have a minimum of three (3) years of relevant prior work experience managing natural resources or fish and wildlife spatial data; creating digital and hard copy map products; technical expertise in obtaining, working with, and organizing spatial data and defining, planning, and implementing spatial analysis and GIS workflows. Work experience with geodatabases, geospatial data services, relational databases, data query syntax such as SQL and familiarity with the Python language are required. Prior experience with ArcGIS Online including Dashboards and Experience Builder is required.




If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply. This position requires some travel and occasional irregular hours to meet project deadlines. Long hours of computer use at a desk are required. On occasion, there may be opportunity to participate in field work requiring physical exertion and possibly under adverse weather conditions. Required application materials are a detailed resume and cover letter. Please review the previous list of requirements when you apply and ensure you submit all three required documents as incomplete applications will be rejected. Candidates progressing to an interview will be required to present a recent GIS project as part of the interview process.




Job Duties:

This position is responsible for planning and managing statewide GIS data and services, developing official map publications, spatial data management, data analysis, map production, technical support/outreach, mapping application development assistance, and cross-division and cross-agency collaboration and support.


Minimum Qualifications:

The knowledge, skills, and abilities of this position are normally attained through combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's Degree in geographic information systems, information management, wildlife or fisheries biology and/or management, natural resources, geography, computer science or a related field and 3-4 years of job related work experience.




Other combinations of education and experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis.



Applicant Pool Statement: If another department vacancy occurs in this job title within six months, the same applicant pool may be used for the selection.
Training Assignment: This agency may use a training assignment. Employees in training assignments may be paid below the base pay established by the agency pay rules. Conditions of the training assignment will be stated in writing at the time of hire.


Salary: $ 31.53 - 31.53 Hourly
Telework Eligibility: Telework Eligible (Full-time telework is not available. Telework schedule must be supervisor approved.)
Benefits Package Eligibility: Health Insurance, Paid Leave & Holidays, Retirement Plan

Company Summary
Public Knowledge® is a national management consulting firm that helps government agencies solve tough problems and thrive in complex environments. We do this by providing planning, procurement, and implementation services. Most of our work is in Health and Human Services. You can learn more about us at www.pubknow.com. The GLI® Group has acquired Public Knowledge®, which provides Public Knowledge® with the financial backing and infrastructure of a larger company.

Inclusion is a core value of Public Knowledge®. We value and seek to create a more diverse workforce. We encourage women, minorities, veterans, people with disabilities, people with different sexual orientations, people with lived expertise, and other diverse people to apply. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and to discover, design, and deliver solutions. We are committed to creating a safe and inclusive workplace that highlights the diversity in all of us and our experiences.

Position Summary
This management consultant would spearhead research efforts to gather information for large projects and programs and propose creative solutions. This person would collaborate with project managers and team members to support project administration, time management, and budgeting.

Duties & Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Research

Gather information for a project by conducting interviews, surveys, facilitating groups, analyzing client documentation, conducting research of best practice and academic literature, and the application of other information gathering tools.
Project Support

Learn and apply the tools and techniques we have for projects.
Work with project managers to support the administration of projects (ensure staff adhere to standards, organizing the time of other team members, supporting project meetings, and assisting with project financial management).
Help your team meet project objectives, timelines, and deliverables within budget.
Analysis, Communication, and Consultation

Using your experience and research results, analyze and organize information identifying root causes of issues, opportunities for improvement, and generate ideas to improve the client situation.
Based on your analysis, research, and experience participate with your team in the development of recommendations for actions that will improve the client situation.
Communicate the results of our work (information, analysis, and recommendations) through the participation in the development and delivery of written reports, formal presentations, and oral discussions with your team, and as requested clients and stakeholders.
Firm Knowledge Sharing and Growth

Freely share your knowledge, skills, and abilities with your peers in the firm.
Perform firm administrative activities (maintain your resume, record your time accurately).
Grow your skills and experience by participating in projects and actively pursuing continuing professional education.
Develop an effective working relationship with clients and colleagues.

About The Role

Under the supervision of the Model Risk Manager, the Model Risk Analyst II will use quantitative expertise, critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills in the bank’s Model Risk Management (MRM) program to ensure compliance with model risk governance policy and regulatory expectations. This role will be responsible for reviewing, documenting, validating and challenging models across the organization. This role will need to understand and execute on multiple modeling techniques and have an ability to communicate effectively at all levels. This role will also participate in MRM governance, including policy and procedures, committee reporting, and findings tracking. In addition, this position will have a role in enhancing and automating existing Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) reports and serve as the primary liaison between ERM and the data governance/business intelligence teams. A successful candidate will display an interest in all areas of risk management and will seek opportunities to learn and contribute in a variety of ways.

This is a Corporate position which may be located at an available bank division location across our eight-state footprint in AZ, CO, ID, MT, NV, UT, WA, or WY. The mid-rate for this position is $76,259.92 + / per year. (calculated for Kalispell, MT).

All compensation offers are analyzed individually and take into consideration multiple factors including but not limited to geographic location, years of experience, and educational background.


In conjunction with the Model Risk Manager, designs and executes model reviews according to guidelines based on SR 11-7 and FDIC-22-2017 to include an assessment of model usage, documentation, conceptual soundness, data integrity, control environment, and the software environment. Presents results and deliverables through formal reports and verbal presentations to model owners and senior management.


Determines the accuracy of significant financial, statistical, and behavioral models that are used within the bank, providing recommendations on how to adjust models to mitigate model risk. Creates challenger models to help validate existing models and contribute to outcome analysis.

Collaborates with model owners ongoing to ensure all models are identified, model documentation is current and complete, model changes are logged, and 1st line of defense monitoring controls are sufficient. Understands and evaluates each of these in order to assess risk and recommend improvements.

Enhances and influences the model program framework including appropriate governance standards, policies, procedures, inventories, findings, and remediation expectations.

Contributes to core ERM functions by designing, creating, and enhancing ERM reports. In particular, use advanced quantitative, data, and reporting software skills to automate the preparation of ERM reports for senior management and board audiences.

Prepares remediation plans and monitor the actions taken by model owners.

Tracks model performance KRIs and KPIs and prepare appropriate dashboard and risk reporting to inform management and board on enterprise-level and model-specific risks.

Leads certain elements of the implementation of a Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC) system and other ERM functions.

Job Title: Senior Revenue Integrity Data Analyst, Revenue Integrity (Full Time)
Job Description:
Benefis is one of Montana’s largest and premier health systems, and we are committed to providing excellent care for all, healing body, mind, and spirit. At Benefis, we work hard to support our employees in every aspect of their careers by offering outstanding benefits and compensation, state-of-the-art facilities, and multiple growth opportunities. The only thing missing is you!

Responsible for revenue cycle reporting and management, accountability, integrity, accuracy, direct supervision, and control of the state/regulatory data, recurring reports, and ad hoc analysis. Responsible for the reporting of trends and KPIs in addition to the development and maintenance of dashboards, work queues, and the administration of internal communication tools. Monitor revenue departments’ adherence to charge reconciliation processes and metrics measured by key performance indicators. Develop tools to track and identify potential areas of lost revenue. Coordinates the charge audit process by entering charge capture data into tracking tools and analyzes audit findings for improved opportunities. Collaborates with key constituents in different functional areas to create charge and billing reports that meet the organization’s requirements and trains individual departments on how to properly generate reports. Monitor national, state, and local information to keep current with applicable regulatory and legislative changes, and communicate potential revenue or workflow impacts to key internal stakeholders in a timely manner.
Demonstrates the ability to deal with pressure to meet deadlines, to be accurate, and to handle constantly changing situations. Demonstrates the ability to communicate and work with a variety of roles and seniorities across the organization, operate effectively in stressful situations, and resolve conflicts.
Will perform all job duties or job tasks as assigned. Will follow and adhere to all requirements, regulations, and procedures of any licensing board or agency. Must comply with all Benefis Health system organization policies and procedures.

Education/License/Experience Requirements:
Minimum of 3 years of healthcare related experience plus Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business, Finance or related field.
Master’s Degree with emphasis in Business, Finance or Healthcare preferred. More than 5 years of related work experience may be considered in lieu of education requirements.
Working Knowledge of: Medical Billing and Hospital Revenue Cycle; Charge Capture Processes; HCPCS, CPT4, ICD-10 coding, Modifiers, Revenue Codes, CCI edits preferred.
Medical Terminology; Basic Human Anatomy; Hospital EMR Systems; & Clinical Documentation Practices required.
High mathematical acumen, ability to access and assimilate data, and articulate a strong case for a recommended course of action required.
